actions.committee: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Mr. Clay moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3325.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 379 - 0 (Roll no. 926).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
actions.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
actions.subcommittee: Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security
actions.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
actions.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 502.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 110-126.

official_title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 235 Mountain Road in Suffield, Connecticut, as the "Corporal Stephen R. Bixler Post Office".

summary.text: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 235 Mountain Road in Suffield, Connecticut, as the "Corporal Stephen R. Bixler Post Office."

titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 235 Mountain Road in Suffield, Connecticut, as the "Corporal Stephen R. Bixler Post Office".
